headline: Lackluster Turnout at Nevada Rally for U.S. Senate Candidate Running Against Trump-Backed Adam Laxalt
author: Katherine Hamilton
sentences:
pic.twitter.com/nNXh95txpO
 Richard Grenell (@RichardGrenell) June 6, 2022
Breitbart News asked the Brown campaign on Monday about former Acting Director of the United States National Intelligence Richard Grenells tweet showing Bush Cheney signs at the rally as well as a reaction to criticism about the events turnout.

Sam Brown, a West Point graduate and Purple Heart veteran, is former Nevada Attorney General Laxalts top competitor ahead of the primary election, with both racing to snag a U.S. Senate seat from vulnerable Democrat Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto (D-NV).

Ultimately, the Republican who wins the primary will need to be a galvanizing force against Cortez Masto, whose under-the-radar leadership style could prove to be a liability for Democrats as the GOP looks to overtake the House and Senate.

Brown has pitched himself as an establishment outsider, despite seeking at least two  and possibly three  different offices in two states over the past seven years and has characterized his run for Senate as a grassroots campaign.

According to NBC News, Brown has reportedly won three straw polls recently and outpaced Laxalt in small-dollar donations, though Laxalt doubled his contributions two months into the second quarter of the election cycle.
Our rally had over 250 Nevadans in attendance, and it took place in the same area where an Adam Laxalt/Ted Cruz rally barely attracted even half that audience size, Browns campaign replied.
The Republican U.S. Senate candidate trailing Trump-endorsed Adam Laxalt (R) in Nevada had a noticeably underwhelming turnout at his rally just a week out from the June 14 primary election.

#nvsen pic.twitter.com/6PtccSrL60
 Sam Brown (@CaptainSamBrown) June 6, 2022
Brown drew online criticism for the seemingly sparse crowd at his event, just a week out from election day.
The Senate-hopeful held a rally at a private business in Minden, Nevada, on Sunday, and his campaign told Breitbart News at least 250 people were in attendance.
Ron DeSantis, and Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX), the Nevada U.S. Senate race will again be an opportunity to test the strength of a Trump endorsement.
Polling over the past month and a half may reflect the event turnout; The most recent survey shows Laxalt leading Brown by 26 points.
Though Laxalt is significantly ahead in the polls and has the backing of high-profile Republicans like Trump, Florida Gov.
Sam Browns very poorly attended event in Nevada (that he hyped would be 1000s) had a sparse showing.
Thank you to the over 250 Nevadans who came to our #DutyFirst rally in Minden today!!
He is not actively engaged or working on any matters for Breitbart News.
This is the grassroots campaign powered by the people, for the people!

The sign belongs to the small business facility owner.
But he did promote Bush-Cheney  with signs and all.
The Liz Cheney-Sam Brown circle is complete.
The sign is not from the Sam Brown campaign.
